TopicTitle: The unofficially official 0.24-Kerbapalooza Thread - Now extra #HYPETRAIN!

Articles.Content: I may visit an asteroid for the first time when .24 comes out...

Really? I would have thought persistence would have been the biggest but I wasn't here at the time.

There weren't many of us around when persistence came out

There weren't many of us around when persistence came out

Good point.

I haven't seen a forum this hyped since I went on a Doctor Who forum just before those missing episodes were announced last year, and that's saying something.

On the fields of Kerbalore at the fall of the 23rd and a half....

On one hand, it might not be today, on the other hand, we know they're testing this release like crazy so it'll be a nice update when it does hit.

The chance of .24 coming out today is 50%

The chance of .24 coming out today is 50%

Either it happens, or it doesn't?

I really don't think massive ASCII blocks is any more better than reaction gifs, guys.

It's considerably easier in the server load. I don't think the mods are here to exact a 'no fun allowed' attitude to those who are excited, just to try and prevent the 502's.

Actually the images are* hosted elsewhere, it's just something that looks like:


<IMG SRC="http://www.not-at-kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/silly_macro.gif">

That isn't any worse for Squad's servers than say:


That isn't any worse than say...

* - all the ones I've seen are. I'm not sure if this forum/bbs software even supports directly attached images.

Either it happens, or it doesn't?

Indeed, with the info we "normal" people have its 50%.

The chance of .24 coming out today is 50%

Good odds for any Kerbal.
It looks like the 502 errors have been beaten. Hooray.

On the fields of Kerbalore at the fall of the 23rd and a half....

when no player can stop adding boosters..

It looks like the 502 errors have been beaten. Hooray.

Genuinely interested, how did you do it?

It looks like the 502 errors have been beaten. Hooray.

Why? Did it get released?
Certainly better odds than most of my missions! I always launch and THEN realize I forgot something, like parachutes, or life support.

when no player can stop adding boosters..

...A release date will be asked about.
Not yet, trust me, you'll notice when it happens. This thread will blow up for about 5 minutes and then die while everyone plays it.

Genuinely interested, how did you do it?

Ah, the joys of keeping things to oneself....

Basicly optimised a lot of settings, you might notice some (limited and temporary) decreased functionality in the forums as a result.

The chance of .24 coming out today is 50%

Yeah, seems like releases usually came out by now, but we'll see. Whatever they did in the most recent update, it changed the file size of the entire package by 1 byte (I know that doesn't mean anything but I found it funny)
I have a feeling it's approaching us...

Good odds for any Kerbal.

"how likely are we to survive?" "50%" "I like those odds"

-Jeb Kerman talking to Gene kerman

Good odds for any Kerbal.

Better than the chances one of my jets will take off the runway! 95% of the time I forget air intakes for some reason heh.

Also better than the chances of the kerbal surviving the landing if FAR is involved..

Yeah, seems like releases usually came out by now, but we'll see. Whatever they did in the most recent update, it changed the file size of the entire package by 1 byte (I know that doesn't mean anything but I found it funny)

Actually, the insignificance of the 1 byte could mean something i.e. they've gotten rid of all the other bugs and are now down to tiny, tiny adjustments. Maybe.

Yeah, seems like releases usually came out by now, but we'll see. Whatever they did in the most recent update, it changed the file size of the entire package by 1 byte (I know that doesn't mean anything but I found it funny)

What's more interesting is that they seem to have skipped the windows 64 bit build. They've been doing win32-win64-linux-mac. Probably just an accident, though.
Joining the Hype train!! ChooChoo!!

yay
